sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A new enterlued for chyldren to playe, named Iacke Iugeler both wytte, and very playsent. The players names. Mayster Boungrace Dame coye Iacke Iugler Ienkin careaway Ales trype and go A galant A gentelwoman The vyce A lackey. A mayd. Jack Juggler. Plautus, Titus Maccius. Amphitruo.
Newly imprented.
[40] p.
In Lothbury by me Wyllyam Copland, [Imprinted at London : [ca. 1565?]
Based on: Plautus, Titus Maccius. Amphitruo. In verse. "Newly imprented" follows the words "very playsent." in the title. The words "Mayster .. go" and "A galant .. mayd." are arranged in two columns on the title page. With three title-page woodcuts. Printer's name and place of publication from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC. Signatures: [A]⁴ B-E⁴. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
A new enterlued for chyldren to playe, named Iacke Iugeler both wytte, and very playsent. The players names. Mayster Boungrace Dame coye Iacke Iugler Ienkin careaway Ales trype and go A galant A gentelwoman The vyce A lackey. A mayd. Jack Juggler. Plautus, Titus Maccius. Amphitruo.
Newly imprented.
[40] p.
In Lothbury by me Wyllyam Copland, [Imprinted at London : [ca. 1565?]
Based on: Plautus, Titus Maccius. Amphitruo. In verse. "Newly imprented" follows the words "very playsent." in the title. The words "Mayster .. go" and "A galant .. mayd." are arranged in two columns on the title page. With three title-page woodcuts. Printer's name and place of publication from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC. Signatures: [A]⁴ B-E⁴. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
me Wyllyam Copland
